notes: Save a trip to the landfill for items that do not fit in their waste and recycling carts or for residents who do not have cart service. This service is free of charge to all Calgarians.
title: Strathcona / Christie Park / Aspen Woods Community Cleanup

notes:
At family golf night, juniors (4-17 years old) golf for free when accompanied by one paying adult/senior. There must be at least one adult/senior per foursome.  Minimum number in a group to book is 2. Single player reservations or walk-on play cannot be accommodated during Family Nights.

Green fees include:

  • 9 holes of golf from 5 p.m. to closing.
  • Giveaways, discount coupons.
  • Golf Pro on site with free golf tips from 5 - 7 p.m.
title: Golf Family Nights - McCall Par 3

notes: Connect with neighbours while your preschooler is active and interacting with other children (ages 0-5) A variety of equipment will be available for use in the gym for unstructured playtime:  trykes, parachute, balls, floor matts and much more.
title: Preschool Indoor Playtime

notes: Fiesta Filipino is the biggest and most colorful street party that showcases the vibrant Filipino and Asian Communities in our city. Check out the Asian Band Showcase and experience all the sights, sounds, and tastes of Filipino culture and heritage.
title: Fiesta Filipino

notes:
For children ages 6+, this course teaches self-awareness and personal safety.  Throughout this interactive workshop, children learn tips for basic personal safety.  All lessons are reinforced through role-playing and group discussion.  FREE!  Register at: activebeltline@calgary.ca

Limited spots are available.  Preferences will be given to children living in the Beltline and surrounding neighbourhoods.

Accessibility barriers:  Multiple staircases to access program space.  Street parking only.
title: Street Smarts

notes:
Drop-in as we visit communities throughout Calgary. Practice and learn how to safely use park fitness equipment that will improve your strength, cardio, and overall well-being. Enjoy the outdoors while a certified trainer guides you with suggestions so you can get the most out of your workout.

Ages: adults only
title: Fit Park Exercises (Adults) - Parkland

notes:
Bring some healthy indoor plant cuttings to share and take some home, while you meet other plant enthusiasts in the neighbourhood!  To ensure everyone gets a plant, we ask that you take no more plants home than you brought to the plant exchange.  If you do not have a plant to exchange, you can bring a new hygiene product to swap and contribute to our REFRESH program.  Examples include new toiletries such as toothbrushes, combs, socks, deodorant, shampoo and soap.

Interested to help plan a community Swap/Exchange?  Contact please contact Silvia Ross, Community Social Worker:
silvia.ross@calgary.ca or text 403-540-0160

Accessibility barriers:  Multiple staircases to access program space.  Street parking only.
title: Beltline Indoor Plant Exchange

title: Stay n’ Play - Dalhousie

notes:
Are you ready to learn all about the wonders of wetlands? Join Calgary Parks to explore these natural spaces and the wildlife that call them home. Discover why wetlands are important and get an up-close view of the amazing critters that live below the surface during a pond dip. Programs will be held at Ralph Klein Park.

Participants must be accompanied by an adult. Recommended for family cohorts with children aged 5-12.
title: Wetland Wonders

All ages

Please email tami.nisbet@calgary.ca to register.

title: Stay n’ Play - Beltline

notes:
Drop in rock climbing on our outdoor climbing wall.  All climbers must be 13 years or older and demonstrate proper use of harness and safe belaying before climbing.  Children 4-12 years old must be belayed by an adult (18 years and up.) All climbers must complete an on site waiver prior to use of the climbing wall.  Climbers under 18 years of age must have a parent/guardian sign the waiver form on site.  Completion of on site belay test will be checked by climbing staff, and a climbing wall card will be given.  Please present this card every time you come.  Helmets are mandatory for children 6-12 years.  

 Please register at activebeltline@calgary.ca
title: Rock Climbing (registration required)

title: Stay n’ Play - Panorama Hills

notes:
August 8-12 2022 

Forest Lawn Community Park - 4307 10 Avenue SE

10 a.m. - 3 p.m. 

Cost: Free

Join us for a self-directed, drop-in program that use loose parts and natural materials to inspire active and creative outdoor play, and connect people, young and old, to nature.

Nature play spaces have been chosen to meet the needs of creative, imaginative, nature-based and self-directed play that are vital to children's cognitive, emotional and social development.

Onsite play ambassadors will be on site to inspire play. Parents are encouraged to stay and watch their children's imaginations soar in this new adventure space
title: Summer Mobile Adventure Playground
